meanings.definition: Existing or occurring at the same time or place as something else.
meanings.sent1: The two buildings were coterminously located next to each other.
meanings.sent2: The meeting and the conference were coterminously scheduled for the same day.
meanings.sent3: The cats and dogs coterminously napped in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter and joy were coterminously infectious.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the rainbow appeared coterminously in the sky after the rain.

meanings.definition: Having the same boundaries or limits.
meanings.sent1: The two countries were coterminously connected by a long border.
meanings.sent2: The park and the forest were coterminously enclosed within the same fence.
meanings.sent3: The two fields were coterminously divided by a small stream.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was coterminously strong and unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The two puzzle pieces fit coterminously together perfectly.
